Don't let that horrible-person thing discourage you. It's just a data point. If it makes you feel any better, science has now validated your birth mother's decision to abandon you on a doorstep."

The singleplayer experience is amazing. The story is wonderful and the difficulty slowly rising makes it fun yet challenging. The multiplayer with a good friend is also a lot of fun. I would highly recommend this game.

Great game, interesting characters with fun voices. Puzzles are engaging, and utilize the mechanics of the game expertly. The puzzles are challenging while not being so difficult as to be unfun. Great sequel to the first game that builds onto existing characters and adds new ones. Dialogue uses humor well, and there are still easter eggs to find involving things you might not do on your first play though that result in dialogue you wouldn't expect or normally hear. Overall excellent game, especially for the price I got it at.
Portal 2 more like portal the sequel.

Better voice acting
Longer game
Better story
More challenging puzzles
Funnier
Better Character Dynamics
Better environments
Better sound design
More puzzle elements to play with
More mods and community made content
More extra content
All of this it does better that a game that perfected those elements (portal)
*Chef's kiss*
